inn1.comm: first bouncer of the morning but wide down the leg side
appeal as it hit the top of the pads, but going over the top
a much more confident shout for a catch behind but again no joy. That one was a yard quicker.
clipped of his legs for a single. A slow but steady start. The aim has to be to see the shine off the new ball and ensure there are no early alarms
cleaned up. No foot movement, played down the wrong line and lost his middle stump
beaten for pace and the batsmen looked a little clueless. Gul generating some speed here
first boundary of the day, overpitched and Watson cracked it through the covers
almighty mix-up left Stanger stranded but Gul threw at the non-strikers stumps from about a yard and missed. All he had to do was amble in and take the bails off.
beat the bat again by the narrowest margin and some extra bounce as well
Stangers charmed life is over. Pace and a little movement off the seam, and he nicked to Inzamam-ul-Haq in the slips. Its all going pear shaped.
Three slips now in and it was through him before he offered a shot. McWillow and McStumpy have yet to offer a view on what happens when you can't lay bat on ball ...
its runs, but unconvincing as an edge flies through the sips, not at catching height though
streaky edge for four as he appeared to be trying to pull his bat out of the way
bouncer that sailed over the batsmans head
appeal for leg-before but outside the line

it might just be me, but there is a suspicion that the BBC might have sent one or two people to commentate who do not boast cricket as their first sport on the CV.  I have never heard a ball described as a bouncy bouncer
Oops. Dropped towards mid-on, Hamilton at the non strikers end set off for a single in response to his colleagues call and was then sent back and was beaten by a direct hit
Loud appeal and hes gone, pitched on middle and off and stayed straight, beaten for pace and as out as out can be
Watson now consolidating which is the right thing to do. Scotland cannot afford to lose another wicket after such a poor start
played into the covers and a well-taken single
turned round behind square for a single
this has been a really good opening spell from Asif. Hes been on the spot almost throughout and not allowed the batsmen to settle
no sooner do I praise Asifs line than he strays down the leg
short and ducked very late
clipped to midwicket off middle and leg, timed well but stopped just short of the boundary
that's more like it. Again clipped off his legs but this one was better timed and it raced over the fast outfield
Asif suddenly looks a bit weary and his line is deserting him as this is the third ball in four speared towards the leg side
Scotland beginning to look a little bit more assured now
Inzamam needs to start thinking about a bowling change now. Both bowlers are beginning to puff
wayward line again
Shot of the day, that. Outside the off stump, overpitched and smeared to the cover boundary. Even tannoyman rendered speechless
the loosest of looseners, outside off stump and blasted through the covers. Inzamam scowls
an ever looser loosener, again outside off stump and again splattered through the covers. Inzamam growls
Razzaq all at sea  yet another one outside off stump and launched through the covers. Inzamam might even be forced to say something rather harsh
See previous comment. Inzamam puffed, scratched his chin and looked cross, not only because of the bowling but also the less-than-able fielding on the boundary.
Played off his legs for a single. A short loosener
Kaneria a bit wayward but he is turning it, albeit not massively
singles being taken with ease
not a particularly impressive start from Kaneria
clipped to leg
Maximum!  Hoisted over cow corner for six. The crowd splutters into life.
pitched right up and McCallum almost managed to york himself
one becomes two as some quite dreadful fielding allows the batsmen to come back for a second
short and thwacked with venom to the square-leg boundary. Razzaq is not at his best to put it politely
dropped at his feet for a single
again, dropped down for a scampered single
Kaneria bowling without any real flight. All a bit lifeless, but in fairness the Pakistan side has not really acclimatised yet
lovely sweep, played on line and length rather than premeditated
big shout for leg-before but Darrell Hair really not interested
bigger shout. The ball appeared to strike Watson in a region that commentators fear to name. But it hurt ... me to look at, let alone Watson himself.
Razzaq has been stung into life and this is a much better over
through McCallum, jagged back off the seam
easy couple as Razzaq strays down the leg
Watson brings up a well-constructed fifty made under difficult circumstances
pushed into the off for an ambled single
lovely ball which deserved more. Watson was caught leaden footed and the edge went between the keeper and the slip to the boundary
no more than a defensive push but fielders slow to react and the batsmen able to take a quick single
this pair are really milking the quick singles well
thats hammered through midwicket for four, pulled from short outside the off stump
googly which foxed the batsman
single brings up the hundred. This represents a good recovery by Scotland who were in dire trouble at 20 for 4
flicked to leg
defensive prod
long and lusty shout for leg before  all in vain
another googly
lovely stroke through the off side, a tad too short
missed sweep which ran off pads for two. However, the umpire seemed to be thinking of something else and he failed to signal leg byes. The batsman smirked, the bowler pouted.
Afridi blotted his copybook but sending down a long hop which Watson hoisted for four. Watson looks good and is getting better
Inzamam has now dropped mid-on and mid-off deep and allowed the single. A surefire sign that its not going as easily as it was early on
again run up to mid-off for the single
faster ball which thwarted an attempt to attack it
plonked into space at midwicket
again Afridi drops a little too short . 100 partnership comes up
swept uppishly but safely behind square leg
swept off middle stump to the square-leg boundary
that one turned a bit, no risk but it certainly spun
swept off middle-and-leg stump to the square-leg boundary but this time with more power and it beat the field
swept for four and Kaneria, taking a breather after his over, a bit slow to react
into the covers for a single
strangled appeal
used feet to drive
another muted appeal

big breakthrough as Watson scoops a return catch to Afridi, it seemed as if he might have been beaten in the flight. Perhaps his concentration was broken by him changing gloves and having a drink at the end of the previous over? A fine innings and he departs to warm applause
cautious defence
a bit of a swish which he misses by some way
well-timed sweep very fine and no chance of anyone cutting that off
flicked just behind square on the leg
tight bowling, defensive push
came down the track and attempted a sweep but missed and it hit him on the pads
another sweep but this time he connected
hit uppishly back towards Afridi, but safely
possibly a bit harsh
plopped down to leg
overpitched and an easy single
into the covers
McCallum brings up his fifty with a single. He has played the anchor role and he needs others to start opening up or the pressure will be on him to so  and he needs to be there at the death
McCallum brings up his fifty. He has played the anchor role and he needs others to start opening up or the pressure will be on him to so  and he needs to be there at the death
Massive shout, pitched outside off but nipped back and it was a question of where it hit him
missed by batsman and keeper, but blushes saved  not for the bowler  as it is signaled wides

Dropped on the boundary. As the fielder took the ball he realised he was falling over the rope and appeared to throw it back. A long consultation between umpire and fielders follows and then the officials seemed to signal six. Another discussion then ensued  but six stands as the crowd start barracking Inzamam who was arguing the point
driven straight back past the bowler for one
scampered two
well fielded at short third-man
attempted to sweep from outside off stump
pushed square on the off for one
swept, as the majority of balls seem to be!
Full toss down the leg side which McCallum tried to thwack into the Firth but missed
Inside edge which Gul makes a hash of at fine leg and its four
two runs to the man on the cover boundary
outside the off stump, driven to deep mid-off
hit into the ground and an easy single as the pace was taken off the ball
swept with real conviction to the backward square boundary
er ... swept again
single to the deep midwicket boundary
stumped after coming down the track and being left in no-mans land. Perhaps he should have kept on sweeping! But a fine anchor innings and one which gave the Scots a decent total
No hanging about as Hoffmann tries to launch the ball over square leg and Asif takes the catch on the boundary edge. A Primary Club application form awaits Hoffmann back in the dressing room
Asif on the button and really putting the pressure on
scampered single into the covers, super pick-up and throw but Lockhart just about safe
pushed to mid-on, but Asif is really strangling the life from the innings
a bouncer to end the over. With three overs left, they have to go down with all guns blazing&
single to long-on
defensive push back to bowler. Have a swing man!
another defensive prod back to the bowler
straight to short midwicket. In club cricket, the non striker would be ordered to run him out ...
finally tried to have a go, top edged over the wicketkeeper and caught in the deep at third man. A fairly poor innings in the circumstances comes to an inglorious end
Nel struggling to get this away as well. Scotland have, sadly, come off the rails in the closing stages when they should have been accelerating
Nel gives himself so much room to hit to leg that the ball passes behind him and still misses his off stump!
well hit through midwicket
clipped backward of square
dropped at cover point but a routine catch goes down. It wont make much difference now
and another spill on the boundary edge to end the fun

inn2.comm: overpitched ball clipped through the onside field for two runs
a full toss as Blain loosens up
nicely turned off his pads for four leg byes!
edged in front of slip but exasperation grows as it flies through the fielder to the boundary. That was a better ball but this is a bit of an expensive start
single after fielder undone by bad bounce
short of a length, a bit of extra pace and fended to first slip. Good breakthrough for the Scots after a slightly iffy start
Blain finding some rhythm
cut straight to point
good ball right on the button
a good start from Hoffmann
smacked past mid-on to the boundary. A shame as that was the first loose ball from Hoffmann
overpitched and well driven straight back past the bowler
fractionally short and run down to third man
not quite to the pitch of the ball and smacked straight at mid-off who held a  straightforward catch
lofted over the top just short of a six
banged in short and he does not have enough pace to get away with that  its hammered down the ground for four
spooned up and it was close to being caught and bowled
a single to the leg side. Nel not off to an accurate start
on middle stump but flicked to the midwicket boundary for two
bump ball which fooled a few in the crowd into thinking that Nel had struck
thick edge onto pad and down to third man where it is well stopped
jagged back in to the batsman
batsman aims a cut and hits hard into the ground and straight to cover
overpitched and down the leg side, an easy couple of runs
squeezed into the covers but never a chance of a run
outside off stump, again into the covers. Hoffmann really in a good spell here
rightly, the batsmen have decided to see Hoffmann off and then take it from there
inside edge towards mid-on but no runs. An excellent maiden
confident shout for lbw but not a realistic one

Nel causes damage to Yousuf by striking him in the nether regions. One of those situations which is agony for the batsmen but which everyone else seems to find highly amusing. Yousuf struggling and in need of time - and a bit more sympathy than is being offered
no lasting damage as Yousuf gains revenge by creaming the first ball after the resumption to the midwicket boundary
driven and well held at gully. A deserved reward for Hoffmann who has bowled a great spell and Pakistan a little wobbly.
straight into the groove with an ambled two to leg
moved across to the off and played defensively into the off side
Another very good over from Hoffmann
effortless clip to leg
and again. Inzamam on the move towards the off as the bowlers in his delivery stride
Nel into the groove of bowling fractionally outside off stump
off outside edge to third man - but not intentionally
A super spell from Hoffmann. Despite what the score says, the official socrers say he took 3 for 22 off his 10 overs
Nel now bowling slightly wider to Inzamam to counter the his shuffle to the off
Inzamam happy to take his time and play the waiting game
full pitch and driven back past Lyons  with interest  and slammed into the fence behind him

well I never  Inzamam called for a quick single and made it with something to spare.  The fielders sneak accusing looks at each other as if that is something that should never happen. In fairness to Inzamam, he looks in good shape
decent enough start from the youngster
thick inside edge into pads
horrible full toss produces a single.  Not intentional, just a slip
mistimed attempted drive.  The lack of any discernable foot movement may have contributed to the lack of timing
Nel digs one in, Inzamam tries to hook and gets a thin top edge through to a sprawling Smith who takes a good catch. The celebrations are genuine and verging on the wild.  A big wicket.
nonchalantly played back to the bowler
interesting. Afridi turned square and looking less than comfortable with that one
the pressure eased with a savage pull of a ball that was far too short to get Afridi off the mark
driven for a single. One ball spoiled an otherwise good over
starts with a wide down the leg side
again down the leg, this time clipped for a single
much better, a good ball on the spot
squirted off the inside edge into the leg side
one to leg
bottom edge off attempted pull, raced down to fine leg. A bad delivery that deserved all it got

Afridi goes for the big hit and only lofts it straight down Hoffmanns throat at long-off. The crowd again roar their delight and suddenly we really have a game on. Pakistan have ample time on their hands but they are making things hard for themselves with some ambitious strokeplay
Razzaq has the air of a man who is looking for an early finish
quick single, no risk, well run
run off the face of the bat for four runs. This is a fast outfield and that was never going to be stopped

cross-batted swish which was just what the situation didnt demand. The 12th man immediately trots on with a selection of replacements as if the shot was the bats fault rather than the man holding it
well flighted and slightly wider
flatter and a single to short third man, only half controlled
dropped short and down the leg side, bashed to midwicket which is only right
tight single and that was a bit close for comfort
that one was more comfortable
driven towards the pavilion for one
single to deep mid-off
another single to deep extra cover
eased into the covers
the experience of one-day cricket now showing as these two pick off singles at will
horrible misfield at backward point and the ball races to the fence. Just what the doctor didnt order
turned to leg for an ambled single to keep Razzaq on strike
outside off stump and one to the cover boundary
struck firmly to backward point and well stopped to prevent the run
through extra cover and two as the fielders scramble for it in the deep
cracking drive which split the infield and four all the way
overpitched and slammed to the extra cover boundary
Watson switches ends and changes to medium pace from offpsin -  but his first ball is slammed up and over the infield for four by Yousuf.  A change of tactics from the Pakistanis?
hit hard to midwicket. They seem to be targetting Watson
too much width outside off but only one to deep cover
played in the air into the covers but a wild throw at the stumps which might have been close for Yousuf had it hit  ends up as overthrows
Darrell Hair turns policeman to give a couple of youngsters who were ambling in front of the sightscreen a death stare. Chastened, they sit down at speed
smeared to the cover boundary and a comfortable two
Watson continuing with his medium pace and a quick single from the first ball
Whoosh  Razzaq launches a massive straight six deep into the Kentucky Fried Chicken stall. No comments about finger lickin' good. Honestly.
More of the same. Razzaq blasts a four to the leg
if he had connected with that one it would still be flying ...
Razzaq really on fire now, although that one was a bit too close to the fielder. Six all the same. The Pakistan flags flutter and the claxons are blown
Yousuf, not to be outdone, heaves four off a ball that was down the leg
Short again, another boundary. A game which seemed to be heading to a fairly sedate finish is now roaring towards a conclusion
That was not one out of any known coaching book  a filthy heave is the politest way to describe that
Another heave which skews off the bat and travels all of ten yards.
He did connect with that and the ball disappears into the crowd at long-off. And now, the end is near
A fitting end as Razzaq slams the ball for a once-bounce four to give Pakistan a five-wicket win
